variationId.Wiki: Used when calculating the ID for attack parameters. It is not used directly on the actual machine.

behaviorJudgeId.Wiki: Used when calculating the ID for attack parameters. This ID matches the action judgment ID entered in TimeActEditor. It is not used directly on the actual machine.

refType.Wiki: Which param type to reference for attack behavior.

refId.Wiki: ID of param to use for attack behavior. Param used determined by refType

dummyPolyRange_Min.Wiki: ID of DummyPoly to use for bullet spawn positions. Value is the start of a range that ends with dummyPolyRange_Max. If max is -1, then a single dummypoly will be used.

dummyPolyRange_Max.Wiki: ID of DummyPoly to use for bullet spawn positions. Value is the end of a range that starts with dummyPolyRange_Min. If max is -1, then a single dummypoly will be used.

bulletEmit_VerticalAdjustment.Wiki: Adjusts the emitted angle of any bullets on the vertical axis. Values between 0 and 128 adjust upwards, values 129 to 255 adjust downwards.

bulletEmit_UnknownAdjustment.Wiki: Adjusts the emitted angle of any bullets, although exact behavior is not known.

bulletEmit_HorizontalAdjustment.Wiki: Adjusts the emitted angle of any bullets on the horizontal axis. Values 0 to 126 adjust to the right, values 127 to 256 adjust to left.

bulletEmit_Orientation.Wiki:
Affects the emitted bullet's direction.
0 - Across
50 - Left Diagonal
100 - Right Straight
150 - Right Diagonal
-50 - Right Diagonal
-100 - Left Straight
-150 - Left Diagonal

bulletEmit_RandomAngleChance.AltName: Bullet Emit: Random Angle Adjustment Chance
bulletEmit_RandomAngleChance.Wiki: 0 is no never randomly adjust angle, 100 is always randomly adjust angle

bulletEmit_ProjectileCurving.Wiki: Larger the value, the more aggressive the angle. Positive is right, negative is left.\nIgnores lock-on.

bulletEmit_InitialEmitHeight.Wiki: The initial height the bullet will go to after being emitted. Negative goes below, positive above.

bulletEmit_BulletAccuracy.Wiki: Assuming 0 is the target's location, positive values will land ahead of target, negative values will land behind.
